definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
old man or woman/the elderly/one's aged parents or grandparents
variant of 老闆|老板[lao3 ban3]
variant of 老闆|老板[lao3 ban3]
variant of 老闆|老板[lao3 ban3]
ordinary people/the "person in the street"/CL:個|个[ge4]
to provide for the elderly (family members)/to enjoy a life in retirement
lit. old general/commander-in-chief 將帥|将帅, the equivalent of king in Chinese chess/fig. old-timer/veteran
native place/place of origin/home state or region

sentences.english: But he must not espouse the old lady needlessly.
sentences.chinese: 不过，他不能毫无必要地娶那个老女人。

sentences.english: Old black Joe still pickin ' cotton.
sentences.chinese: 老黑人乔仍然在摘棉花。

sentences.english: Jack was one of his old compatriots.
sentences.chinese: 杰克是他的老伙伴之一。

sentences.english: The invention discloses a construction method for a door opening of an old structural underground wall.
sentences.chinese: 本发明公开了一种老结构地下墙开门洞施工方法。

sentences.english: "Emotion and molding" was very similar to the old topic of emotion and art.
sentences.chinese: “情感与造型”，似是重提了情感与艺术的老话题。

sentences.english: He is always tell the director how to run the business; that's like teach his grandmother to suck egg.
sentences.chinese: 他老是对总裁说该如何管理业务，就跟班门弄斧似的。

sentences.english: No wonder his wife is penniless; he is always playing the horses and losing his money. (CDIP)
sentences.chinese: 难怪他妻子身无分文，他老是赌赛马，把钱都输光了。

sentences.english: Pinocchio was not able to walk, therefore, the boss sold him to an old drummer.
sentences.chinese: 木偶行唔到，于是老板就卖左比个老鼓手。

sentences.english: So the old tree demon could not find us.
sentences.chinese: 所以老树精就找不到我们了。

sentences.english: Her hands were like the dry bark of an old cak tree, wrinkled, rough and hard.
sentences.chinese: 她的手向老树皮一样生皱粗糙和坚硬。

sentences.english: Shall weave old England's winding sheet .
sentences.chinese: 为老英格兰织起裹尸布。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, Master Roshi is confronted by an old rival.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，龟仙人又遇到了他的一个老对手。

sentences.english: This album of painting is a gift since old professor.
sentences.chinese: 这本画集是一位老教授捐赠的。

sentences.english: If you spend all the money you get, you will have to depend on pension when old.
sentences.chinese: 若把所有钱都“月光”掉，老了将只能靠养老金。

sentences.english: Some of Guling's older villas have now been redesignated as museums or shrines.
sentences.chinese: 牯岭的一些老别墅如今被重新设计成博物馆或神殿。

sentences.english: The textology of the Qing Dynasty is an old subject in the academic circle.
sentences.chinese: 清代考据学是学术界多次探讨的老问题。

definition: to admit to one's advancing years/to acquiesce to old age
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
geezer with one foot in the grave (used jokingly or as an imprecation)
few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
